Description: Textile corner-fragment; undyed linen cloth, medium quality; plain selvedge; remains of hitched warp fringe; triple self-band; vertical edges torn, horizontal edges cut. Brown and blueish stains, the latter possibly modern and the former causing holes - iron mould? The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun; the stitch gauge is warp c.22 ends per 10mm and weft 10 picks per 10mm. The thread used for hitching the fringe is Z-plied, one row of knots worked from one side of the cloth, the other from the other side. Presumably from a mummy.
